meanings.definition: A quick, sharp, sudden movement or twist.
meanings.sent1: He gave a jerk to the rope to pull it tight.
meanings.sent2: The sudden jerk of the car made me spill my drink.
meanings.sent3: The jerk of the roller coaster made everyone scream with excitement.
meanings.sent4: With a jerk, he opened the stubborn jar lid.
meanings.sent5: The jerk of the dancer's body amazed the audience.

meanings.sent1: That guy is such a jerk, always making rude comments.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand being around that jerk at work.
meanings.sent3: The jerk at the party kept hogging the snacks.
meanings.sent4: He acted like a jerk, thinking he was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent5: The jerk's behavior was unacceptable to everyone.

meanings.definition: To move with a quick, sharp, sudden motion.
meanings.sent1: She had to jerk the door to get it unstuck.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman had to jerk the fishing rod to catch the fish.
meanings.sent3: He tried to jerk the stubborn zipper open but failed.
meanings.sent4: The sudden gust of wind caused the boat to jerk to the side.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to jerk the knife to cut through the tough meat.
